paragraphs.text:
%md
## Initialize Spark Context and Spark SQL Context

result.msg: Initialize Spark Context and Spark SQL Context

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql import SQLContext
sc
sqlContext = SQLContext(sc)

%md
## Creating DataFrames from JSON files

result.msg: Creating DataFrames from JSON files

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
business = sqlContext.read.json("/zeppelin/datasets/yelp/yelp_academic_dataset_business.json")
users    = sqlContext.read.json("/zeppelin/datasets/yelp/yelp_academic_dataset_user.json")
reviews  = sqlContext.read.json("/zeppelin/datasets/yelp/yelp_academic_dataset_review.json")

%md
#### TODO : Create checkins and tips DataFrames

result.msg: TODO : Create checkins and tips DataFrames

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# checkin path file : "/zeppelin/datasets/yelp/yelp_academic_dataset_checkin.json"
# tip path file "/zeppelin/datasets/yelp/yelp_academic_dataset_tip.json"

%md
## Print and explore schemas

result.msg: Print and explore schemas

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
reviews.printSchema()
users.printSchema()

result.msg:
root
 |-- business_id: string (nullable = true)
 |-- date: string (nullable = true)
 |-- review_id: string (nullable = true)
 |-- stars: long (nullable = true)
 |-- text: string (nullable = true)
 |-- type: string (nullable = true)
 |-- user_id: string (nullable = true)
 |-- votes: struct (nullable = true)
 |    |-- cool: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- funny: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- useful: long (nullable = true)

root
 |-- average_stars: double (nullable = true)
 |-- compliments: struct (nullable = true)
 |    |-- cool: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- cute: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- funny: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- hot: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- list: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- more: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- note: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- photos: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- plain: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- profile: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- writer: long (nullable = true)
 |-- elite: array (nullable = true)
 |    |-- element: long (containsNull = true)
 |-- fans: long (nullable = true)
 |-- friends: array (nullable = true)
 |    |-- element: string (containsNull = true)
 |-- name: string (nullable = true)
 |-- review_count: long (nullable = true)
 |-- type: string (nullable = true)
 |-- user_id: string (nullable = true)
 |-- votes: struct (nullable = true)
 |    |-- cool: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- funny: long (nullable = true)
 |    |-- useful: long (nullable = true)
 |-- yelping_since: string (nullable = true)

%md
## Register DataFrames as tables

result.msg: Register DataFrames as tables

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
business.registerTempTable("businessTable")
users.registerTempTable("usersTable")
reviews.registerTempTable("reviewsTable")

sqlContext.sql("select * from reviewsTable limit 11").show()

%md
### How many businesses and users are registered based on this yelp dataset ?

result.msg: How many businesses and users are registered based on this yelp dataset ?

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
print "business record count "+ str(business.count()) 
print "users record count " + str(users.count())

result.msg:
business record count 77445
users record count 552339

### Find out the number of businesses from each city

result.msg: Find out the number of business from each city

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
sqlContext.sql("select city, count(*) as count from businessTable group by city").show()

result.msg:
+--------------------+-----+
|                city|count|
+--------------------+-----+
|          Pineville |    1|
|              Monona|   79|
|            Rockport|    1|
|           Fort mill|    1|
|           henderson|    1|
|      Laveen Village|    3|

|        West Mifflin|   33|
|             Buckeye|  131|
|                Dane|    2|
|       Montreal-West|    2|
|           Brookline|    1|
|              Laveen|   79|
|      Deux-Montagnes|    1|
|           Sun Lakes|   12|
|         McAdenville|    1|
|            Montreal|   88|
|Sainte-Anne-De-Be...|    7|
|          Blainville|    2|
+--------------------+-----+
only showing top 20 rows

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Which are the top 10 cities based on number of businesses ?

result.msg: Which are the top 10 cities based on number of businesses ?

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
sqlContext.sql("select city, count(*) as count from businessTable group by city order by count desc").show(10)

result.msg:
+----------+-----+
|      city|count|
+----------+-----+
| Las Vegas|17423|
|   Phoenix|10629|
| Charlotte| 5189|
|Scottsdale| 5139|
|  Montréal| 3891|
|Pittsburgh| 3337|
| Edinburgh| 3272|
|      Mesa| 3190|
| Henderson| 2839|
|     Tempe| 2773|
+----------+-----+
only showing top 10 rows

%md
## Saving sql query results

result.msg: Saving sql query results

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.types import *
sqlContext.sql("select city, count(*) as count from businessTable group by city order by count desc").show()
sqlContext.sql("select city, count(*) as count from businessTable group by city order by count desc").write.save("/zeppelin/datasets/yelp/output/sqlresult")

result.msg:
+---------------+-----+
|           city|count|
+---------------+-----+
|      Las Vegas|19328|
|        Phoenix|11852|
|      Charlotte| 5695|
|     Scottsdale| 5638|
|       Montréal| 4371|
|           Mesa| 3638|
|     Pittsburgh| 3628|
|      Edinburgh| 3360|
|      Henderson| 3145|
|          Tempe| 3043|
|       Chandler| 2702|
|        Madison| 2278|
|       Glendale| 2048|
|        Gilbert| 1941|
|         Peoria| 1081|
|North Las Vegas|  952|
|      Karlsruhe|  906|
|       Surprise|  681|
|       Goodyear|  507|
|      Champaign|  505|
+---------------+-----+
only showing top 20 rows

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Checking the saved result

result.msg: Checking the saved result

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
df = sqlContext.read.load("/zeppelin/datasets/yelp/output/sqlresult")
df.registerTempTable("test")
sqlContext.sql("select * from test order by count desc").show()

result.msg:

## Run SQL directly of files

df.show()
